reviews.review: Was a great movie my kids loved it!
took my 2 boys (9 and 7) and they loved it!
The movie was excellent. We all enjoyed it. it had a nice story line and kept us laughing. it was a cute movie and perfect for all ages.
Amazing character development, and such depth to their heroic journeys that can teach great morals to kids and even adults. Absolutely loved it. So much emotion from a cartoon.
I thought this was better than Frozen 1 - very engaging and funny!  Would see again for sure.

LOVED IT! Loved how adventurous it was and the story line of two different people who loved each other for who they are and fixing a problem that shouldnt have been done in the first place! How Elsa and Anna were strong in their own ways in their own scenes and at the end showed the strength of two of them together for the better of all people!

Took my 7 year old son to see it this weekend and we all loved it!  Remember, this is a Disney movie meant for children.  It explores adult themes in a way children can relate to.  So to all the critics who go in depth with criticisms about why it's not that great, the only true critic who matter of a movie like this is CHILDREN and all the children I know absolutely love it.  The child in me agrees!  

Furthermore, I loved the songs.  If fact, there are more memorable songs out of this movie.  The last one only had 2 songs; "Let it go" and "Do you want to build a snowman."  I would argue this one has at least 5 awesome songs, songs that only get better the more you listen to them.  Personally, my favorite song is "Show Yourself" rather than the feature song, "Into the Unknown."  Idina Menzel's vocal performance on this song is even better than "Let it go."  I hope "Show Yourself" is nominated for an Oscar.
Everyone come together . Even thou they lived separate places .
I love all of the songs in frozen 2, It makes some scene to fantastic and I want to standing ovation at the end credit.

It was not just a movie, it was an experience.  The music, the animation,  the story line was much much better that first film hands down. I enjoyed every moment of this film. The message alone hit a home run with me in so many ways. Just a pure delight.  My daughter loved it as well.
